data.title: fix #2136; Indicate the host/admins in game lobby
Shellmap Music Option doesn't actually do anything
data.body:
In CNC, there is an option for "Shellmap Music". But it doesn't do anything. 

On top of this, I don't see any option in YAMLs to set the music in the shellmap. This should be the case, as right now, I am assuming you are compiling code to do so.

data.title: [patch] new AI with optimized build order
data.body:
Eisenhower builds less radar domes (only 1) and less refineries (it seems to stop at 5 in the end game, but builds the second one early after the barracks) and can spend therefore more money on units. It techs faster  and also builds more advanced units (Mammoth tanks and Tanyas/Medics). It won't build any turrets to become more offensive and because the placement algorithm is not very clever at the moment. (see issue #2064)

```
    HackyAI@EisenhowerAI:
        Name:Eisenhower AI
        BuildingFractions:
            proc: 25.1%
            powr: 35%
            tent: 0.1%
            barr: 0.1%
            weap: 0.1%
            fix: 0.1%
            dome: 0.1%
            atek: 0.1%
            stek: 0.1%
        UnitsToBuild:
            e1: 50%
            e2: 1%
            e3: 10%
            medi: 0.01%
            e7: 0.01%
            apc: 10%
            jeep: 10%
            ftrk: 25%
            1tnk: 25%
            2tnk: 50%
            3tnk: 75%
            4tnk: 100%
            arty: 30%
            v2rl: 30%
        SquadSize: 10
```

data.title: Game Timer
data.body: Any chance of the game timer being added to the Host list?

data.title: Crates should be picked up when landing on a unit
data.body:
Just a thought.
can Crates be made to auto-pickup when landing ON a unit?
seems stupid to have to wait for it to land before moving

data.title: Game Options
data.body:
New Game Options should be implemented. They are present in many games, even those outside the C&C Realm. Here are a few things that I was thinking of:
- [x] Crates: These should be an option, while you could get a nuke in your face, you could also get a free nuclear missile.
- [x] Starting Units: This is obvious. Many C&C games have this option.
- [ ] Major Superweapons: Nukes are disabled/enabled. Also disables nuke crates
- [ ] Minor Superweapons: Chronosphere and iron curtain is disabled/enabled. Also disables Parabombs crate
- [x] Starting Cash: Many Games have this option, please add it.

data.title: [wish] ConvertPngToTmp for OpenRA.Utility.exe
data.body: Currently there is the command line option `--tmp-png MOD[,MOD]* THEATER FILES        Extract terrain tiles to PNG`. I already have an .R8 reader for my Dune 2000 mod. However I need to convert the resulting PNGs to tiles somehow. TilesetBuilder 1 and 2 export are broken for me.

data.title: Terrain on build menu should be unclickable
Bug: repair image after defeated
data.body: If you are defeated and in that moment you have had a repair option chosen, after defeat you still have it and can point at ally buildings to repair. When you click on damaged building, repair key is appeared at it for 0.5 second and then disappeared.

data.title: Request: different sound for `game starts` from chat sound
Track APM for multiplayer games and show in spectator/replay view
more flexible HackyAI for Dune 2000 mod
data.body: In commit 4984d079606902f3ecb3003ed0d7a4455222d189 (pull request #2155) I changed all hardcoded unit/structure identifier into variables (your automatic "get things from YAML" is impressive btw) and allowed more MCVs (Dune 2000 has three because the construction yards it deploys into look different). I did not touch RallypointTestBuilding as suggested in issue #2184.

data.title: Capturing enemy buildings should allow some builds
data.body:
I think if you capture a construction yard, barracks, etc. that you should be able to build the things that you have in common with the opponent, at least. Right now when I capture an enemy conyard, all I can build is a power station. I don't know what the current consensus is on building another side's units, but building things in common seems reasonable to me.

Left to do:
- [x] Tiberian Dawn https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5685
- [x] Red Alert https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5759
- [x] Dune 2000 https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5891
- [x] Tiberian Sun #7376

<bountysource-plugin>

---

data.title: remove AI movement/attack bottleneck
data.body:
AI movement has a tendency to get confused and walk in circles. I believe someone called it "following the leader". In this image, an enemy squad of soldiers sits aimlessly (right outside my base), occasionally moving but mostly sitting still: http://i.imgur.com/7CmVq.jpg

When the AI is attacking, they wait until their entire first attack wave is destroyed before attacking again. This can result in 1 or a few soldiers who get confused holding back an entire army.

Only when that little squadron is destroyed is the AI finally permitted to attack with the big army it had been amassing in its base:
http://i.imgur.com/imlWK.jpg

data.title: "AllowMultiple: yes" disables airstrike power
data.body: In CNC, when the HQ building has "AllowMultiple: yes" for the airstrike power, you can no longer click on the airstrike power icon when it's ready, to select a target.

data.title: AI: RallypointTestBuilding is a problem for different faction buildings
data.body: The bot AI's hardcoded `public readonly string RallypointTestBuilding = "fact";` is a problem for the Dune 2000 mod as it has 3 different construction yards.

data.title: GiveMcvCrateAction should support different units for each faction
data.body: Dune 2000 needs 3 different MCVs to construct the 3 different construction yards. GiveMcvCrateAction should support this just like SpawnMPUnits supports different starting units for each faction.

data.title: Implement Volkov as the Soviet Hero
data.body:
Volkov should be the new soviet hero, replacing Tanya. I have him finished; he is on the unit resources site. But he needs balancing and bug finding.

Volkov: http://content.open-ra.org/?p=detail&table=units&id=132

data.title: In a multiplayer game, if a player is defeated/lost in someway, their assets should be transferred to another ally.
data.body:
This issue has two purposes. They are both closely related.

When a player is defeated, all of their assets, including remaining units and cash, should be transferred to an ally. This is the case in all modern C&C games.

When a player is disconnected for some reason, all of their assets should also go to an ally. There should be an equation present however, to prevent a few issues with this.

If a player quits, and has allies, it should first look for an ally that is of the same side of him. If yes, it will transfer assets to one of those players, preferably the one that is the worse off. If not, it will transfer assets to a player that is worst off.

When subfactions are implemented, there should be a way to say that that side is the same as another side. Say we have countries in the game. Then the allied countries will treat each other as "allied" instead of "england" or "france." But of course, it will find the exact subfaction first, then the other subfactions of that faction.

data.title: d2kmod brainfart: hover units
data.body:
I write this here because this idea will probably take some coding. 

I was thinking about remaking House Ordos somewhat along the lines of Emperor: BFD. And to do this, they need a new unit type: hovering vehicles. 

They would have these features:
- They would hover off the ground. Functionally, they would look like low flying helicopters. Like aircraft, they'd cast an automatic shadow and they'd rock up and down slightly like helos do in OpenRa to create the appearance of flight.
- d2k has rough ground features that either stop or slow down vehicles. A sand tileset exists that slows down tanks. In the rock terrain, a tileset with large rocks stop vehicles entirely, but is accessible to infantry. Ordos hover tanks would be able to move across both of these terrain types without slowing down at all. (cliffs and such would of course stop them, since they're not actually flying but that's obvious:)
- the hover vehicles would not be able to squash infantry, but they wouldn't be stopped by them either. Instead, when infantry is flown over by hover vehicles, they are forced to go prone, but remain unharmed. The hover vehicles fly over enemy and friendly infantry alike.
- although not relevant to d2k, they would also be able to move over water.
- of course, this unit type could be used in other mods as well if people like it.
